articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.title: Palestinians say north Gaza destruction is widespread as rights group warns some may never return

articles.author: Michael Martina
articles.description: With his nomination of China hardliner Marco Rubio for secretary of state, U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has signaled his policy toward Beijing could go beyond his focus on tariffs and trade to a more hawkish stance towards China as the United States' top strategic rival.
articles.title: Rubio pick signals a Trump China policy that could go beyond tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli authorities have caused a forced displacement of Palestinian people in Gaza to an extent that constitutes war crimes and crimes against humanity, Human Rights Watch said in a report on Thursday.
articles.title: Human Rights Watch accuses Israel of war crimes over Gaza displacements

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Plumes of smoke rose over Beirut, while airstrikes and artillery shelling inflicted heavy damage on buildings in southern Lebanon’s Bint Jbeil.
articles.title: Israel strikes Hezbollah areas in Beirut, southern Lebanon for third day

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey was offered partner country status by the BRICS group of nations, Trade Minister Omer Bolat said, as Ankara continues what it calls its efforts to balance its Eastern and Western ties.
articles.title: BRICS offered Turkey partner country status, Turkish trade minister says

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: South Korea's Supreme Court upheld on Thursday the conviction of the former head of an advocacy group representing victims of Japan's wartime sexual abuse for embezzlement and sentenced her to 18 months in prison, suspended for three years.
articles.title: South Korea top court upholds conviction of 'comfort women' activist over embezzlement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fifteen people were killed and 16 injured in Israeli attacks on a number of residential buildings in suburbs of the Syrian capital Damascus on Thursday, state news agency SANA reported, citing a Syrian military source.
articles.title: Israeli attacks on Syria's Damascus kill 15, state media says

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: President Joe Biden heads to South America on Thursday for a curtain call with global leaders after over 50 years in U.S. politics, but the man he tried and failed to keep from returning to power is likely to be the focus of many meetings: incoming U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Biden to bid farewell at APEC and G20 under Trump's shadow

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sri Lanka's president's coalition, the National People's Power (NPP) posted an early lead in a parliamentary election, local television channel Ada Derana said on Thursday.
articles.title: Sri Lanka president's coalition leads in early vote count, Ada Derana reports

articles.author: Eduardo Baptista, Marco Aquino
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will arrive in Lima on Thursday, kicking off a week-long diplomatic blitz in Latin America by inaugurating the massive Chancay deep-water port, one of Beijing's most ambitious infrastructure investments in Latin America.
articles.title: China's Xi arrives in Lima for APEC, to open Pacific megaport
